intro: Neuwiedia zollingeri var. singapureana, commonly known as the Singapore Neuwiedia, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to Singapore. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are ovate with a glossy surface, and it produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
